page.title: 06BELGRAVE LODGE
page.content: Belgrave Lodge was opened in 1967 by Lord Mayor E.J.Williams.There are 44 old people and 26 staff.The building is square.The living rooms where the people rest during the day are also used as dining rooms.There are about 10 armchairs in each room and a television.The bedrooms,which are mostly shared,are well furnished. There are no stairs for the old people to get up,but the staff who live there sleep upstairs.The bathrooms have a small square bath,a sink and a toilet. There are more ladies than men living in Belgrave Lodge.The average age is 80-100 years.Two ladies will be 101 this year. Lady Diana came to visit Belgrave Lodge in 1982.They have a plaque and some pictures to remember her visit.
